page.title: 17WALKING IN ETON
page.content: Between the built-up areas of Eton, Datchet and Slough and the areas set aside for recreation ,there is still some land available for farming.The neighbouring farmland of Eton Wick overlaps our area.We went for a walk across it. First we passed through a hay-field,then a barley field and then across the road to a larger field of a different strain of barley.The public footpath we followed petered out where the new Windsor to Slough by-pass intercepted it.Standing in the field we could see the by-pass, the M.4.motorway,the Victorian railway via-duct and the minor road to Eton Wick.We compared the arches of the new by-pass with the old viaduct.Farming in the middle of so much transport must be strange,we thought.There is another area of farmland to the north of Datchet,adjoining the motorway.
